content:
Hi folks! :wave:

I've been using Rust for nearly three years now but only since the last year or so it's become my go to language (even at work now the only thing we use is Rust!).

For the most part I'm a hobbyist langdev/osdev so I'm planning on studying and helping to maintain the compiler as much as I can :) I've always wanted to try my hand at contributing and so hopefully I can find some tasks to help out and pitch in with!
There is a github organization about OSes in Rust
It should have many things of interest to you :slight_smile:
Beat you to it :wink: ( https://github.com/orgs/rust-osdev/people?query=mental )
Hi @mental! You will find resources to get started in the rustc-dev-guide. Don't hesitate to ask questions in #t-compiler/help as needed.

that's useful to know, thanks @LeSeulArtichaut !

I've currently got several thousand browser tabs open with different resources, books and repos that I'm going to familiarize myself with e.g. rustc dev guide, the compiler team guide and the chalk book (I wanna make sure I do my homework on this lol)

As for issues to work on, using the label filters on the repository is probably your best bet! Use the @rustbot claim command to assign the issue to yourself and show that you are working on it. If you don't find any issue to work on, I think DPC can help you find some.
too late @LeSeulArtichaut ;) I know Mental from some months now and we've been working on a few issues already :D
